ygData.msgSnippet: (According to the AMERICAN version the ARK crashed into MT saint Helens, and made it erupt in the 80 s when they awoke. In this game the ARK crashed somewhere

(According to the AMERICAN version the ARK crashed into MT saint 
Helens, and made it erupt in the 80's when they awoke. In this game 
the ARK crashed somewhere in Tibet.)OH well I guess we'll have to 
book a cruise. As long as it's not aboard the Titanic.

Lunarpine continued to look at Shadow Wing, was it because of her 
beautiful white feathers, or because of the animal she represented. 
Either way she was out of his class. (science joke.) They shared this 
world, this land, this night, and most importantly, this journey.

"tell me again Shadow Wing, why are you helping me?"

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> OOC:(I thought the original arc landed on the North American 
continent. But 
> I could be wrong)
> 
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She flew next to him. She wondered about this bot. He was bigger, 
stronger, 
> and more deadly as a fighter than she was, but for some strange 
reason, she 
> didn't fear him.  She looked at him for a moment.  As a wolf, he 
was a great 
> credit to his kind. She was still wary of him thought, after all, 
they had 
> just met.  She looked at him as he asked his question.
> "I'm not sure who will meet us there.  It depends on what is 
happeneing when 
> we get there.  I have been out of contact with the arc for a while 
I'm not 
> sure who will greet us."
> She flew next to him.
> 
> 
> ----Original message-----
> From:   <cyberwolf4@p...>
> Date: Fri Jun 30, 2000 5:51pm
> Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
> 
> Lunarpine transformed back to wolf and followed his new freind, His
> bot said to trust her as a fellow maximal, but his wolf instincts
> viewed her as competition. In the wild a wolf and owl compete for 
the
> same food. he hoped that would be different with the maximals. He
> didn't want to hurt her, even to survive.
> Lunarpine shook his head, trying to seperate the logic and instincts
> buried in his head. To justify both he asked two questions.
> "Shadow Wing where are we going and who will greet us when we
> arrive?
> (side question- how are we getting across the ocean from canada to
> Tibet?)
> 
> 
> 
> 
>
